sentence: And we are respected again, I can tell you that.
vclaim: Today, "the United States is the most respected country on Earth."

sentence: They have forgotten that our ancestors trounced an empire, tamed a continent, and triumphed over the worst evils in history.
vclaim: Neville Chamberlain told the British people Accept the Nazis. Yes, they will dominate the continent of Europe, but that is not our problem. Let's appease them. Why? Because it can't be done. We cannot possibly stand against them.

sentence: They have forgotten that our ancestors trounced an empire, tamed a continent, and triumphed over the worst evils in history.
vclaim: Over 200 years ago, the United States had declared war on Islam, and Thomas Jefferson led the charge!

sentence: America is the greatest fighting force for peace, justice, and freedom in the history of the world.
vclaim: President Obama "went around the world and apologized for America."

sentence: America is the greatest fighting force for peace, justice, and freedom in the history of the world.
vclaim: Says Ronald Reagan said immigrants"brought with them courage and the values of family, work, and freedom. Let us pledge to each other that we can make America great again."

sentence: America is the greatest fighting force for peace, justice, and freedom in the history of the world.
vclaim: Several times, Obama "has apologized for what he deems to be American arrogance, dismissiveness, and derision for dictating solutions, for acting unilaterally ... ."

sentence: America is the greatest fighting force for peace, justice, and freedom in the history of the world.
vclaim: A few months into office, (President Barack Obama) traveled around the globe to apologize for America.

sentence: We are the nation that built the highways, the railroads, the Empire State Building in one year, the Golden Gate Bridge, and we are the nation that built the Panama Canal.
vclaim: America is a nation of builders. We built the Empire State Building in just one year. Isnt it a disgrace that it can now take 10 years just to get a minor permit approved for the building of a simple road?

sentence: We won two world wars, defeated communism and fascism, and put a man on the face of the moon.
vclaim: Says the first word spoken from the moon was "Houston."

sentence: We cured disease, pioneered science, and produced timeless works of art that inspire the human soul.
vclaim: Anywhere in the world, when someone uses a mobile phone, email, the Internet or GPS, they are enjoying the benefits of the American miracle.

sentence: Our economy is the strongest it has ever been.
vclaim: The United States of America, right now, has the strongest, most durable economy in the world.

sentence: Our economy is the strongest it has ever been.
vclaim: Yesterday we had the strongest dollar in the history of our country.

sentence: Our economy is the strongest it has ever been.
vclaim: Business spirit is the highest it's ever been, according to polls.

sentence: Our economy is the strongest it has ever been.
vclaim: Consumer confidence, business confidence, and manufacturing confidence are the highest they have been in many decades.

sentence: We have begun the great rebuilding of the United States military.
vclaim: My first order as president was to renovate and modernize our nuclear arsenal. It is now far stronger and more powerful than ever before.

sentence: We have begun the great rebuilding of the United States military.
vclaim: Even our nuclear arsenal doesn't work. It came out recently they have equipment that is 30 years old. They don't know if it worked.

sentence: We have begun the great rebuilding of the United States military.
vclaim: Says Donald Trump "claimed our armed forces are 'a disaster.'"

sentence: We have ended the disastrous defense sequester.
vclaim: It isn't me cutting the budget. It's the Congress'decision on sequestration. So it isn't secretary of defense or the president doing this.

sentence: We have ended the disastrous defense sequester.
vclaim: I did not support the sequester.

sentence: We have ended the disastrous defense sequester.
vclaim: The sequester is not something that I've proposed. It is something that Congress has proposed.

sentence: We have ended the disastrous defense sequester.
vclaim: There's no plan from Senate Democrats or the White House to replace the sequester.

sentence: We have ended the disastrous defense sequester.
vclaim: The sequester "wont consider whether were cutting some bloated program that has outlived its usefulness, or a vital service that Americans depend on every single day. It doesnt make those distinctions."

sentence: We have ended the disastrous defense sequester.
vclaim: Military spending cuts, known as the sequester, were President Barack Obamas idea.

sentence: We have ended the disastrous defense sequester.
vclaim: Due to the sequester, "people are going to be unsafe. Homes are going to burn."

sentence: We have ended the disastrous defense sequester.
vclaim: If the sequester hits, federal prosecutors will have to "let criminals go."

sentence: And we have just secured, you have read all about it, a $700 billion, largestever amount of money to support our great war fighters.
vclaim: Just last year we gave the military a $700 billion budget increase, which they didnt even ask for.
comment-2: last year mentioned in the claim

sentence: They're liking the sound of million, but billion is betterthe $700 billion goes to $716 billion, and we are going to be stronger than ever before.
vclaim: Just last year we gave the military a $700 billion budget increase, which they didnt even ask for.

sentence: We have now the lowest number of ships we have had since World War I.
vclaim: Under sequestration, the military was cut "down to the smallest Army since 1940, the smallest Navy since 1915."

sentence: We have now the lowest number of ships we have had since World War I.
vclaim: Says President Obama "is reducing our naval fleet to 1917 levels..."

sentence: We have now the lowest number of ships we have had since World War I.
vclaim: Barack Obama, right now, No. 1, over seven years has dramatically degraded our military.

sentence: We have now the lowest number of ships we have had since World War I.
vclaim: The United States is "about to have the smallest Army since before WWII, the smallest Navy since WWI and the smallest Air Force ever."

sentence: We have now the lowest number of ships we have had since World War I.
vclaim: The U.S. military is at risk of losing its "military superiority" because "our Navy is smaller than it's been since 1917. Our Air Force is smaller and older than any time since 1947."

sentence: We have now the lowest number of ships we have had since World War I.
vclaim: Our Navy has shrunk from more than 500 ships in 1991 to 275 in 2016.

sentence: And very soon, we are going to get to 355 beautiful ships.
vclaim: President Trump proposed the increase to $700 billion to our military budget, which included the 355ship Navy, which included a military pay increase, a modest one, which included, a yet even more modest housing allowance, but yet (Sen. Tim Kaine) even voted against giving more money to our men and women who are in the military service and against our housing allowance.

sentence: And very soon, we are going to get to 355 beautiful ships.
vclaim: The U.S. military is at risk of losing its "military superiority" because "our Navy is smaller than it's been since 1917. Our Air Force is smaller and older than any time since 1947."

sentence: And very soon, we are going to get to 355 beautiful ships.
vclaim: Says Mitt Romney wants to add $2 trillion to defense budget that the military hasnt asked for.

sentence: You are going to have new equipment, and welldeserved pay raises.
vclaim: Says the 2018 defense authorization bill includes raises for the military "for the first time in 10 years."

sentence: You are going to have new equipment, and welldeserved pay raises.
vclaim: Milwaukee police and firefighters "are routinely getting 4 percent raises annually while everybody else is either getting zero or one percent raises."

sentence: You are going to have new equipment, and welldeserved pay raises.
vclaim: Last year, I was involved with an effort to to help prosecutors get their first pay raise in more than 10 years.

sentence: We just got to a big pay raise for the first time in 10 years.
vclaim: Says troops recently received "one of the biggest pay raises" ever, and that it was the first pay increase in "more than 10 years."

sentence: We just got to a big pay raise for the first time in 10 years.
vclaim: Says the 2018 defense authorization bill includes raises for the military "for the first time in 10 years."

sentence: We just got to a big pay raise for the first time in 10 years.
vclaim: The National Defense Authorization Act for fiscal year 2019 "includes the largest pay raise in nearly 10 years."

sentence: We got to a big pay increase, first time in over 10 years.
vclaim: Says troops recently received "one of the biggest pay raises" ever, and that it was the first pay increase in "more than 10 years."

sentence: And this week, we passed new landmark legislation to give more choice and better care to our great veterans.
vclaim: Says "Marco Rubio wrote and passed bipartisan legislation allowing the VA to fire negligent workers."

sentence: And this week, we passed new landmark legislation to give more choice and better care to our great veterans.
vclaim: Says Republicans"just passed" the Veterans Choice program after 44 years of trying. "They've been trying to pass that one for many, many decades."

sentence: And this week, we passed new landmark legislation to give more choice and better care to our great veterans.
vclaim: Says "Donald Trump is a guy who has called for privatization" of the Veterans Administration.

sentence: And this week, we passed new landmark legislation to give more choice and better care to our great veterans.
vclaim: Says Donald Trump supports "an agenda out there" to privatize the Veterans Affairshealth care system.

sentence: We are taking care, finally, after decades, we are taking care of our veterans.
vclaim: Says Republicans"just passed" the Veterans Choice program after 44 years of trying. "They've been trying to pass that one for many, many decades."

sentence: We passed VA accountability.
vclaim: Says "Marco Rubio wrote and passed bipartisan legislation allowing the VA to fire negligent workers."

sentence: We passed VA accountability.
vclaim: Says Republicans"just passed" the Veterans Choice program after 44 years of trying. "They've been trying to pass that one for many, many decades."

sentence: We passed VA accountability.
vclaim: Nine hundred people have been fired since I became secretary (of Veterans Affairs). Weve got 60 people that we fired who have manipulated wait times.

sentence: We passed VA accountability.
vclaim: At the same time President Trump talks about supporting veterans, "he is deporting service members who have volunteered to serve this country."

sentence: We are reestablishing the second fleet in the Atlantic bigger, better, stronger than it has ever been before.
vclaim: Our Navy has shrunk from more than 500 ships in 1991 to 275 in 2016.

sentence: We are reestablishing the second fleet in the Atlantic bigger, better, stronger than it has ever been before.
vclaim: Says President Obama "is reducing our naval fleet to 1917 levels..."

sentence: We are rebuilding our defense industrial base to forge American iron, aluminum, and steel, which, by the way, we just put tariffs on when it comes in from other countries.
vclaim: American aluminum and steel "are vital to our national security. ... They are the bedrock of our defense industrial base."

sentence: We are rebuilding our defense industrial base to forge American iron, aluminum, and steel, which, by the way, we just put tariffs on when it comes in from other countries.
vclaim: All across Ohio, steel mills are reopening.

sentence: We are rebuilding our defense industrial base to forge American iron, aluminum, and steel, which, by the way, we just put tariffs on when it comes in from other countries.
vclaim: Electrolux, Sweden's largest appliance maker, has just abandoned a $250 million investment in the United States because of the steel tariffs. That is retaliation.

sentence: We are rebuilding our defense industrial base to forge American iron, aluminum, and steel, which, by the way, we just put tariffs on when it comes in from other countries.
vclaim: Says the U.S. steel and aluminum industry is "a fraction of what it once was."

sentence: They pay that big, beautiful tariff and it goes right into building new ships.
vclaim: Tariffs are "paid for mostly by China, by the way, not by us."

sentence: We have been taken advantage of by the world.
vclaim: This is the most generous country in the world when it comes to immigration. There are a million people a year who legally immigrate to the United States.
